ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. For those who want to do further research in tales and late imperial chinese literature, professor Tina Lu's classes are your best choice. For those who are not interested in the two fields might not choose this course.

I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve their classical Chinese and to get an understanding of this particular genre and style of writing. I would not necessarily recommend it to students studying modern Chinese or to anyone who does not already have a background in classical Chinese.
I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in imperial fiction, history, or classical Chinese language.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It provides me many interesting and profound perspectives and facilitates me with the newest ideas in this field. I become interested in Tang and Song tales only after her teaching.
A more accurate grasp of literary Chinese.

This course fit exactly into my area of research, and I learned a lot of material that I had never read. I broadened my understanding of the genre and classical narrative. This course has heightened my understanding of classical Chinese and I will be able to use the material in my dissertation.
